Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description job requisition idREQ-1989 Product Specialist Intern 2026 - Winter W26 Product Specialist Intern 175075B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List At Interac, we design and deliver products and solutions that give Canadians control over their money so they can get more out of life. But that's not all. Whether we're leading real-time money movement, driving innovative commerce solutions like open payments for transit systems, or making advancements in new areas like verification and open banking, we are playing a key role in shaping the future of the digital economy in Canada. Want to make a lasting impact amongst a community of creative thinkers, problem solvers, technical gurus and high-performance application developers? We want to hear from you. Reporting to the Product Team Lead, the Product Specialist Intern will work cross functionally with the Technology, Operations and Product teams to build experiences, deliver real solutions and support with improving Interac's Foundational practice. You'll be responsible for: • • • • Developing proof-of-concept solutions for the Technology and Operations team Conducting analysis of the existing API and Identity platforms provide suggestions to improve processes Building out technical documentation for the Technology and Product Team Working with the agile team to support the delivery of enhancements to Interac's technology & platforms Supporting various solution initiatives with a dedicated agile team • Job Requirements You bring: • You are currently enrolled in a university or college program in a relevant discipline, like computer science or information technology/systems, software/computer engineering, business managment or similar related field • You can confidently understand technical concepts and enjoy tackling challenging problems by utilizing your creative thinking skills • • • • • • • • • • • • Familiarity with API Management, Gateways and Identity Management concepts Comfortable with learning and working effectively either independently or with groups across different functions and levels.? Confidence in your ability to communicate verbally and written in a detailed and impactful way you have some experience with technical writing You are a proactive problem-solver with a demonstrated track record of driving continuous improvement initiative An aspiration to work in software development after graduation The natural ability to pick up new technology - you enjoy learning about new tools and how they work Understanding that success is in the details - you tend to notice things that others don't Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: Technical concept and follow through them Lead solution design sessions Understanding of Atlassian, Confluence & Jira Previous working or co-op experience working as a software developer, engineer or technical coordinator in a relevant field is an asset Workstyle: Hybrid (3 days on-site) Location: Toronto Term: January - April 2026 Duration: Monday - Friday Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Careers at Interac Corp. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
